newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Telebras may take Portugal Telecom stake.
newsitem.headline: Telebras may take Portugal Telecom stake.

text.p: Brazilian telecommunications group Telebras may eventually take a stake in Portugal Telecom but such a move was not being contemplated at the moment, the chairman for the Portuguese concern said.
"It is an hypothesis but it is not possible at the moment," Francisco Murteira Nabo told a news conference called to give details of their announced joint venture Alianca Atlantica.
Murteira said the company's various strategic partners could eventually take up to 7.5 percent of the company which the Portuguese government is privatising in phases.
The Anglo-American Concert alliance of British Telecom and MCI has 1.5 percent of the Portuguese company while's Spain's Telefonica de Espana has 3.5 percent.
The joint venture includes the Atlantis cable linking Europe, Africa and South America.
